isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 2000, 4000, 8000 - BATTERY, CHARGING AND CRANKING SYSTEMS - OPERATION - Charging Circuits

svcprocinfo.para: For a complete discussion on operating principles for alternators, refer to GROUP 08 - ELECTRICAL in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual for the specific alternator being serviced.

svcsubproc.title: International Engines
svcsubproc.para: When the vehicle is running, the alternator supplies power through the alternator or (BAT) terminal, and circuit 2 to a splice. From the splice, current flows through 2 fusible links, 2-FL and 2A-FL to the crank motor solenoid battery stud. From this stud, current flows to the batteries through the positive battery cable. Power is also applied to the junction block feed stud (J1) through circuit 14-FL/14, connector (1CF), and circuit 14.

The alternator also supplies power from the (I) terminal (Delco 22-SI), or connector (430) (Delco CS-130), through circuit 1A/1-RW, bulkhead connector (2) and (2A), and circuit 1 to the accessory feed block (J2).
The alternator is grounded through the (GRD) terminal and circuit 2-G to the starter motor ground stud (G).

svcsubproc.title: Cummins M11E, L10 STC and Caterpillar Engines
svcsubproc.para: When the vehicle is running, the alternator supplies power through the alternator (BAT) terminal and circuit 2 to the magnetic switch positive stud. From this stud, the alternator supplies current to the batteries through circuit 14/14-FL to the positive stud on the starter solenoid and then through the positive battery cable. From the magnetic switch stud, the alternator also supplies power to the vehicle electrical components through circuit 14 to the junction block feed stud (J1).

With the Cummins M11E and Caterpillar engines, the alternator is grounded through the (GRD) terminal and circuit 2-G to an engine block ground. From the engine block ground, the ground circuit to the starter motor ground stud (G) ) is through a 6 gauge wire with Cummins or circuit 11-GL with Caterpillar.
With the Cummins L10 STC, the alternator ground is through the (GRD) terminal and circuit 11-GL to the starter motor ground stud (G).

svcsubproc.title: Cummins N14E Engine
svcsubproc.para: When the vehicle is running, the alternator supplies power through the alternator (BAT) terminal and circuit 2 to a splice, and 2 fusible link circuits, 2-FL, to the crank motor solenoid battery stud. From this stud, current flows to the batteries through the positive battery cable. From the solenoid battery stud, power is also applied to the (J1) junction feed stud through 2 fusible link circuits, 14-FL, to a splice, circuit 14 to the magnetic switch, and circuit 14.
The alternator is grounded through the (GRD) terminal and circuit 11-GL, to the starter motor ground stud (G).
